title: Ukraine Retakes Southeast Village of Urozhaine
details: The move signals Ukraine is proceeding with its southern offensive toward the Sea of Azov; Ukraine has struggled to make progress due to extensive Russian minefields and defensive lines

title: Saudi Arabia Hosts Talks on Path to Peace in Ukraine
details: Officials from some forty countries, including the United States and Ukraine, will meet in Jeddah to discuss a peace blueprint for ending the war in Ukraine; envoys from India, Brazil, and South Africa will attend, while Russia will not

title: Russia Strikes Ukrainian Port
details: The port is situated across the Danube River that has served as Kyiv’s main channel for exporting grains since Moscow pulled out of the Black Sea grain deal last month; the attacks have sent grain prices higher as Russia escalates its attempt to prevent Ukraine from exporting grain. overall, Russian strikes have destroyed 180,000 tons of grain since they withdrew from the deal last month, sending global grain prices soaring

title: Ukraine Sends New Troops into Battle in Country’s South
details: The move constitutes a new push in Ukraine’s ongoing counteroffensive against Russian forces; heavy fighting was reported around the village of Robotyne in southern Ukraine

title: Russia Strikes Ukrainian Alternative Grain Export Route
details: Following Moscow’s dissolution of the Black Sea Grain Initiative, Russian drones yesterday attacked Ukrainian grain warehouses and other facilities on the Danube River, an alternative route for Ukraine to export grain without using the Black Sea ports currently blocked by Russia

title: Russia Strikes Odesa Port Infrastructure and city for the fifth consecutive day
details: Russia said it struck a fuel storage facility and a weapons plant in the port city of Odesa in Ukraine today in retaliation for yesterday’s attack by Ukrainian forces on a bridge leading to Russia-occupied Crimea

title: Russia Launches Air Strikes On Odessa For Second Consecutive Night
details: A Ukrainian presidential advisor said the attacks were targeting grain terminals and port infrastructure; they come days after Russia withdrew from a deal that allowed Ukraine to export grain from its Black Sea ports

title: Russia Announces Withdrawal From Black Sea Grain Deal
details: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s spokesperson said that Russia will no longer cooperate with a deal to allow Ukraine to export grain from its Black Sea ports, sparking fears of a further strain on global markets as tens of millions of tons of food exports are put at risk; since the deal was first implemented, Russia has complained that Western sanctions have hurt its ability to export agricultural products

title: Russia Closes Bridge to Crimea After Two Explosions
details: Russia blamed Ukraine for strikes on the Kerch Strait Bridge, which is a vital link for Russian war supplies, that killed two people and injured one

title: Wagner forces to continue fighting in Ukraine with a new leader
details: Andrei “Sedoi” Troshev, a senior Wagner commander involved in the group’s Syria operations, would take over from Yevgeny Prigozhin, who led his mercenaries in a rebellion in June (Reuters). Russian President Vladimir Putin announced that Wagner forces would be permitted to continue fighting, but could not longer be led by Prigozhin

title: NATO-Ukraine Defense Council Meets Amid New Pledges of War Aid
details: Leaders of North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) countries met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy today as part of a new joint body focused on Ukraine’s security, with Group of Seven (G7) countries also laying out sustained security guarantees for Ukraine aimed at ensuring its military capabilities

title: United States to Send Cluster Bombs to Ukraine in $800 Million Security Package
details: Citing written assurance that Ukraine would use them carefully, U.S. officials said they deferred the move as long as possible but that the risk to civilians was greater if Ukraine ran out of ammunition and faced a renewed Russian offensive

title: 700,000 Ukrainian Children Now in Russia
details: The head of Russia’s upper house of parliament claimed the children have taken refuge in Russia, while Ukraine said they have been forcibly deported

title: Wagner Group Will No Longer Fight in Ukraine
details: The lower house of parliament's defense committee chair said Wagner would no longer receive state funding or fight in Ukraine after Yevgeny Prigozhin refused to sign contracts to bring the mercenaries under the control of the Russian defense ministry

title: Russian Strike on Kramatorsk Kills At Least Ten
details: A Russian strike on a popular pizza restaurant in the eastern city also wounded at least sixty-one, Ukraine’s National Police said

title: Wagner Group Stops Short on March to Moscow
details: After quickly seizing the southern military command in Rostov-on-Don, Wagner forces advanced more than halfway to Moscow

title: Wagner Group Rebels Against Russia’s Military Establishment
details: After months of brewing tensions, Wagner boss Yevgeniy Prigozhin released a video claiming the Russian Ministry of Defense attacked his troops and announced a “march for justice” against the military leadership

title: Ukraine Strikes Crimea’s Chonhar Bridge
details: It is one of the few bridges that connects Crimea to mainland Ukraine, and Russia vowed to retaliate

title: Donors Pledge Economic Support for Ukraine at London Conference
details: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said at a two-day London donors conference today that the European Union (EU) plans to provide $54.5 billion in aid for Ukraine’s economic recovery over the next four years, while the United States announced another $1.3 billion in aid

title: Russia Launches Nationwide Air Assault on Ukraine Overnight
details: The raids targeted agriculture and telecommunications infrastructure across the country, and Ukraine claims to have shot down twenty-eight out of thirty Iranian-made drones

title: Heavy losses reported from both troops in Zaporizhzhia
details: British intelligence said both sides have taken heavy losses during intense fighting in Zaporizhzhia but said Russia’s defenses have been “relatively effective”

title: Russia Deploys Nuclear Weapons to Belarus
details: The delivery of these relatively short-range, less powerful tactical nuclear weapons, fit for use on the battlefield, marks the first time Russia has deployed such weapons beyond its borders since the fall of the Soviet Union

title: Putin claims weapons' shortage in Ukraine
details: Russian President Vladimir Putin told pro-war bloggers at the Kremlin yesterday that Russian forces in Ukraine lacked weapons, including precision-guided munitions, aircraft, and tanks; Russia’s weapon production capabilities have been hampered by Western sanctions

title: Presdent Zelensky signals start of Ukraine counteroffensive
details: President Volodymyr Zelensky on Saturday offered the strongest confirmation yet that the long-anticipated Ukrainian counteroffensive had begun, as battles along a 600-mile front line offered further evidence that the long-awaited counterattack was underway

title: Kakhovka Hydroelectric Dam breached resulting in extensive flooding
details: The Kakhovka Hydroelectric Dam in the city of Nova Kakhovka in Ukraine's Khersonska Oblast breached and the wall collapsed in the early hours of June 6th.

title: Anti Putin groups continue raids into Beleogrod oblast
details: Elements of the all-Russian pro-Ukrainian Russian Volunteer Corps (RDK) and Freedom of Russia Legion (LSR) reportedly conducted another raid into Belgorod Oblast on June 1

title: Sixteen missile and drone attack on Kyiv in the month of May
details: The Ukrainian capital came under attack for the 16th time this month after a second successive night of bombardment

title: Russia signals they are moving nuclear warheads to Belarus
details: Russia moving nuclear warheads to Belarus

title: Anti-Putin groups launch an attack into Beleogrod oblast
details: Elements of the all-Russian pro-Ukrainian Russian Volunteer Corps (RDK) and Freedom of Russia Legion (LSR) conducted a raid into Belgorod Oblast on May 22.

title: Anti-Putin Russian Fighters Claim Attack on Russian Villages
details: The Freedom of Russia Legion, which says its fighters are Russians, claimed yesterday’s ground attacks in the Belgorod region near Russia’s border with Ukraine; Russian officials blamed Kyiv for the attacks, but Kyiv denied responsibility

title: Ukraine Launches Attacks on Bakhmut’s Outskirts After Russia Claims It Took City
details: Russian forces said they captured the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut over the weekend, but Ukrainian officials disputed the claim and said their forces were advancing on the city’s northern and southern outskirts today

title: Zelensky meets G7 as Ukraine wins access to F-16s
details: Zelensky meets G7 as Ukraine wins access to F-16s

title: Russia launches 'unprecedented' air attacks on Ukraine's capital Kyiv
Russia agrees to extend the Ukraine grain deal again
details: The United Nations and Turkey brokered the deal last July to allow Ukraine to export grain through the Black Sea amid its war with Russia; the agreement has been repeatedly extended since then

title: Hypersonic missile attack on Kyiv
Ukraine repels ‘exceptional’ Russia missile, drone attack on Kyiv
President Zelenskyy visits UK and requests more military support
Ukraine strikes Russian forces in Luhansk before expected counteroffensive
Ukrainian forces have made gains northwest of Bakhmut in localized counterattacks
More than 1,600 residents were evacuated from around Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant
details: Some 1,679 people, including 660 children, have been evacuated from areas near the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, a Moscow-installed official in the Russia-controlled parts of the Zaporizhzhia region of Ukraine said late on Sunday. The head of the U.N.’s nuclear power watchdog warned on Saturday that the situation around the plant has become “potentially dangerous” as Moscow-installed officials began evacuating people from nearby areas.

title: Wagner Boss Threatens to Leave Bakhmut Over Lack of Support From Moscow
details: Yevgeny Prigozhin, the commander of the Wagner Group mercenary organization, threatened to pull his forces out of the Ukrainian city by May 9, saying Moscow is not providing enough ammunition for his fighters

title: Russia Launches Strikes on Ukrainian Cities as Kyiv Denies Role in Kremlin Explosions
details: Russian forces launched aerial attacks on Kyiv and Odesa last night after two drones exploded over the Kremlin yesterday; no casualties were immediately reported from the strikes on Kyiv and Odesa

title: More than 20,000 Russian soldiers killed in five months in Ukraine, US says
details: More than twenty thousand Russian soldiers have been killed and over eighty thousand have been injured in the war in Ukraine since December, according to estimates by U.S. intelligence officials; many of the troops died in trench warfare around the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut

title: A Russian missile attack wounded at least thirty-four people in the east Ukrainian city of Pavlohrad
details: Russia launched its second large salvo of missiles at Ukraine in recent days early Monday, damaging buildings, killing two people and wounding 40 in the eastern city of Pavlohrad but failing to hit Kyiv, officials said.

title: Russian missile attacks killed at least twenty five people in central and southeastern Ukraine
details: Russia hurled missiles at cities across Ukraine as people slept on Friday, killing at least 25 civilians in the first large-scale air strikes in nearly two months, as Kyiv said it was nearly ready to launch a huge assault to retake occupied land.

title: Putin Seizes Some Western Energy Companies’ Russia-Based Assets
details: The decree signed by Russian President Putin grants temporary state control over the Russian divisions of German firm Uniper and Finnish firm Fortum; the decree called the moves a response to “unfriendly” actions by the United States and its partners

title: Ukraine Has Almost All Combat Vehicles Promised By Allies
details: More than 98 percent of the combat vehicles that Western backers promised Ukraine ahead of its planned spring counteroffensive have reached the country, a top North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) official said

title: UN Secretary General Condemns Russia's Invasion
details: Diplomats from the United States, the UK, and Switzerland joined UN Secretary-General Guterres in condemning Russia’s invasion of Ukraine during a UN Security Council meeting that Russia chaired yesterday

title: Russia, Ukraine Raise Conscription Requirements
details: Russia’s government passed laws making it more difficult to escape the draft, while Ukraine will now allow the government to serve conscription notices anywhere in the country; the moves come as Ukraine is expected to launch a spring counteroffensive against Russia

title: U.S., Germany, Hungary Oppose Road Map for Ukrainian NATO Membership
details: They are pushing back against attempts by countries including the Baltic states and Poland to support Ukraine’s future membership in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), four officials told the Financial Times

title: Poland Pledges Additional Fighter Jets to Ukraine
details: During Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s visit yesterday, Poland said it will soon send ten more jets to Ukraine; Poland has already delivered four jets to the country

title: British, German Tanks Reach Kyiv as Ukraine Prepares for Spring Offensive
details: The first deliveries of British Challenger tanks and German Leopard 2 tanks reached the Ukrainian capital, German and Ukrainian officials confirmed

title: Putin Says Russia Will Store Tactical Nuclear Weapons in Belarus
details: Following the announcement by Russian President Vladimir Putin, European Union foreign policy chief Josep Borrell threatened sanctions against Belarus in a tweet, and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called for an emergency meeting of the UN Security Council

title: International Monetary Fund staff agreed with Ukraine on a $15.6 billion financing package
details: International Monetary Fund staff agreed with Ukraine on a $15.6 billion financing package. If the IMF's board signs off, it would be Ukraine's biggest loan since Russia invaded a year ago.

title: $411 Billion Needed to Rebuild Ukraine After a Year of War according to World Bank
details: The sectors that most urgently need rebuilding, including energy, housing, and critical infrastructure, will require around $14 billion in 2023, the bank estimated; this week, the International Monetary Fund approved a $15.6 billion loan to support the country’s recovery

title: Ukraine said Russian cruise missiles were destroyed in a strike in Crimea
details: Ukraine said Russian cruise missiles were destroyed in a strike in Crimea, but did not claim responsibility for the attack. The Russian-installed head of the city of Dzhankoi reported drone attacks there.

title: Putin makes a surprise visit to Mariupol and tours an occupied city destroyed by war
details: Russian President Vladimir Putin made an unannounced trip to the occupied city of Mariupol on Saturday, touring parts of the Ukrainian city that is now rebuilding after fierce attacks by Russian forces last year.

title: The Russian offensive in Ukraine has slowed
details: The tempo of Russian offensive operations across the theater has slowed in recent weeks, suggesting that the Russian spring offensive in Donbas may be nearing culmination.

title: Russia agrees to extend the Ukraine grain deal again
details: Turkey and Ukraine say the agreement with Russia to allow grain exports from Ukrainian ports through a safe corridor in the Black Sea has been extended.

title: The International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for Putin
details: The International Criminal Court has issued an arrest warrant for Russian President Vladimir Putin for alleged war crimes involving accusations that Russia has forcibly taken Ukrainian children. The ICC also issued a warrant for Putin's commissioner for children's rights, Maria Lvova-Belova.

title: Poland and Slovakia to send MiG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine
details: Poland and Slovakia announced plans to send around a dozen MiG-29 fighter jets each to assist Ukraine’s war effort, becoming the first North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) countries to supply warplanes after the United States, Germany, and the United Kingdom declined requests to do so.

title: International Court to open war crime cases against Russia
details: According to knowledgeable former officials, the International Criminal Court will open two war crimes cases against Russia over its invasion of Ukraine; the cases allege that Russia abducted and sent Ukrainian children to Russian re-education camps

title: 81 missiles and 6 drones in massive attack on Ukraine energy infrastructure
details: Large scale missile and drone attack on Ukraine energy syste,

title: U.N. Secretary-General António Guterres went to Kyiv
details: “The position of the United Nations, which I have consistently expressed, is crystal clear: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is a violation of the UN Charter and international law”, declared the UN chief.

title: Russian forces now control 50% of Bakhmut
details: Russian forces now control 50% of Bakhmut according to ISW

title: Two key bridges in Bakhmut were destroyed
details: Ukraine is reinforcing the area with elite units, and within the last 36 hours two key bridges in Bakhmut have been destroyed, including a vital bridge connecting the city to the last main supply route from Bakhmut to the city of Chasiv Yar.

title: Russia Accuses Ukraine of Cross-Border Raid
details: In an unverified claim, Russian officials said that Ukraine carried out a sabotage raid across the border near the Bryansk region and shot two civilians; Ukraine has denied any involvement in the incident, calling it a "provocation

title: Putin Orders Officials to Bolster Security
details: President Vladimir Putin made the order after drone attacks targeted several areas in southern and western Russia; while Russia's defense ministry has accused Ukraine of the attacks, Ukrainian officials have not claimed responsibility

title: 50 people detained in Russia after protests against the war
details: Independent Russian outlet OVD-Info reported that police detained at least 54 people for anti-war demonstrations at which they picketed, laid flowers, and wrote messages in the snow.[12] The arrests suggest that the protests were far more limited in scale than they had been earlier in the war, since Russian authorities detained 1,800 people on the first day of the war and almost 5,000 on March 6, 2022

title: UN to Vote on Resolution Calling for Russian Withdrawal From Ukraine
details: The UN General Assembly will vote today on a nonbinding resolution that demands Russia “immediately, completely and unconditionally withdraw all of its military forces from the territory of Ukraine”

title: Putin Halts Russian Cooperation in New START Nuclear Treaty
details: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the suspension during a wide-ranging speech that falsely accused Kyiv and its Western allies of starting the war in Ukraine; the treaty is Russia’s last remaining arms control agreement with the United States

title: Russia Fires Four Missiles at West Ukraine
details: Russia launched four Kalibr missiles from the Black Sea, two of which were shot down by air defense, according to Ukrainian officials; two civilians were wounded, and several windows were shattered from the blasts in the Ukrainian city of Khmelnytskyi

title: Russia launched 36 cruise missiles across Ukraine in a single day
details: Russia rained missiles across Ukraine on Thursday and struck its largest oil refinery, Kyiv said, while the head of the Wagner mercenary group predicted the long-besieged city of Bakhmut would take weeks if not months to fall. Following a pattern of heavy bombardments after Ukrainian battlefield or diplomatic gains, Russia launched 36 missiles in the early hours, Ukraine's Air Force said.

title: Russian Balloons Shot Down Over Kyiv
details: Officials said they identified six Russian balloons floating over Kyiv, most of which have since been shot down; a military spokesperson said Russia uses such balloons for “reconnaissance or to confuse air defense systems”

title: New Sanctions on Export Bans Against Russia from EU
details: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen today unveiled proposed export bans on goods from the European Union (EU) that Russia could use in its military campaign against Ukraine; over $11 billion worth of goods would be targeted in the sanctions package, which would be EU countries’ tenth against Russia since it invaded Ukraine

title: Russian mounts round the clock attacks on Ukraine
Russia Bombards Bakhmut in New Offensive
details: According to NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg, a major new Russian offensive has begun in the eastern Ukrainian city of Bakhmut, where heavy artillery fire began days before the first anniversary of Moscow's invasion

title: Ukraine Reports Highest Rate of Russian Deaths Since War Began
details: According to Ukranian data, 842 Russian soldiers are dying per day this month, the highest reported rate since the first week of the invasion; the United Kingdom's ministry of defense could not verify the numbers but said the trends are “likely accurate”

title: New Wave of Strikes on Ukrainian Infrastructure led by Russian forces
details: Russian missiles and drones targeted infrastructure sites across Ukraine today, damaging power facilities in six regions and prompting blackouts

title: OHCHR reports over 7,000 civilians deaths
details: OHCHR records over 7155 civilians killed since the beginning of the conflict

title: Ukraine Replaces Defense Minister
details: Following a corruption scandal in its Defense Ministry, Ukraine announced Major General Kyrylo Budanov, currently head of military intelligence, will replace Oleksiy Reznikov as Defense Minister

title: EU Imposes Ban on Russian Diesel Purchases
details: The European Union (EU) ban on diesel and other refined oil products took effect yesterday; it comes alongside a Group of Seven (G7) price cap on sales of Russian diesel, jet fuel, and gasoline

title: EU Officials Affirm Support for Ukraine at Kyiv Summit
details: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and European Council President Charles Michel are visiting Ukraine’s capital, Kyiv, today in the first European Union (EU) meeting in a country at war; while Ukraine’s EU membership is pending, Von der Leyen said it could potentially join some “key European programs” in the meantime

title: Russia makes important gains in eastern Ukraine
details: Russian forces gained a foothold in the town of Vuhledar in Donetsk province, marking Russia's largest advance in months; Kyiv described the offensive as human wave attacks

title: Russia Launches Air Strikes on Kyiv, Other Ukrainian Cities
details: Officials in Ukraine said most missiles were repelled by the country’s air defenses, while Kyiv’s mayor said one person was killed; the barrage came a day after the United States and Germany announced they were sending main battle tanks to Ukraine

title: Ukraine says that its forces have retreated from Soledar after an intense battle
details: Ukraine's military acknowledged the Russian takeover of Soledar, retreating from the eastern town after a tough battle. Russian forces continued their offensive around Bakhmut and other parts of the Donetsk region of eastern Ukraine.

title: Germany to Send Leopard Tanks to Ukraine
details: Germany will send fourteen Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine and allow other countries to export their own German-made tanks to help Ukraine fight Russian forces, Chancellor Olaf Scholz announced (FT). The United States will soon announce that it will send about thirty of its M1 Abrams main battle tanks to Ukraine, unnamed U.S. officials told the Wall Street Journal

title: Top Ukrainian Officials Dismissed Amid Anticorruption Push
details: op officials in Ukraine’s presidential office, Defense Ministry, and Prosecutor General’s Office resigned or were removed from their posts in the country’s largest leadership shake-up since Russia invaded; several regional governors were also ousted

title: Ukraine Helicopter Crash Kills At Least Seventeen, Including Interior Minister
details: The crash in a Kyiv suburb today killed Internal Affairs Minister Denys Monastyrskyi and several other officials; it also damaged a kindergarten and a residential building, killing at least four children on the ground

title: Russian Strike in Dnipro Kills At Least 40
details: A Russian strike on an apartment building in the eastern Ukrainian city of Dnipro killed at least forty people on Saturday, Ukrainian officials said

title: Chief of the General Staff Army General Valery Gerasimov takes over as Russian commander for Ukraine operation
details: Chief of the General Staff Army General Valery Gerasimov will take over as theater commander as part of a major reshuffle of the Russian command structure for the war in Ukraine

title: Kyiv Rejects Moscow's Claim It Killed 600 In Eastern Attack
details: Ukrainian authorities rejected Moscow’s claims that Russian forces killed six hundred people in an attack in Kramatorsk, while some pro-Russia bloggers accused Russian officials of overblowing the story (NYT). However, Ukraine said it was strengthening its forces near Bakhmut amidst constant attacks by the Wagner Group

title: Ukrainian Strike Kills Dozens of Russian Fighters
details: Moscow said the strike killed sixty-three troops in a Russia-occupied suburb east of Donetsk, Ukraine, while Kyiv said the death toll could be in the hundreds

title: A unilateral 36-hour ceasefire in Ukraine declared by Russian president for 1/7 Othodox Christmas
details: A unilateral 36-hour ceasefire in Ukraine declared by Russian president Vladimir Putin came into effect on 1/7 (Orthodox Christmas)

title: Russia Rejects Ukraine’s Peace Conditions, Bombards Its Power Grid
details: Russia fired nearly seventy missiles at Kyiv and other Ukrainian cities today in what appeared to be one of its biggest strikes on Ukraine’s energy grid; Ukraine’s military said it shot down fifty-four of the missiles. The attack came hours after Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov reiterated Moscow’s rejection of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s conditions for peace; in recent weeks, Zelenskyy has promoted a peace plan in which Russia would face a war crimes tribunal and give up occupied territories in eastern Ukraine. A Kremlin spokesperson yesterday rejected the possibility of ceding the territories, while Lavrov said today that Kyiv’s plans to drive Russia out of eastern Ukraine were an “illusion”

title: Russia Bans Oil Sales to Countries With Price Caps
details: Starting February 1, Russia is banning oil exports to countries that have imposed a price ceiling on Russian oil; the price cap of $60 per barrel was adopted earlier this month by Group of Seven (G7) countries, the European Union, and Australia in an effort to deny Russia of revenue amid its war in Ukraine

title: Ukraine Reportedly Strikes Air Base Deep Within Russia
details: Ukraine did not publicly acknowledge the missile attack, which the Russian Defense Ministry said killed three Russian fighters

title: Russia Launches Drone Attack on Kyiv, Hitting Critical Infrastructure
details: Ahead of Vladimir Putin's visit to Belarus, Russia launched a 'kamikaze' drone attack targeting critical energy infrastructure in and around Kyiv; the Ukrainian military said it shot down twenty-three of the twenty-eight drones

title: Russia Launches Extensive Missile Assault on Ukraine
details: Russia fired more than seventy missiles across Ukraine in one of its largest Russian offensives since the start of the war, forcing the government to implement emergency power cuts nationwide; the attacks came after the Ukrainian government warned of a wave of fresh offensives from Russia as they near the one year anniversary of the invasion

title: Ukraine Shoots Down Russian Drones Over Kyiv
details: Ukrainian officials said they shot down over a dozen drones believed to be targeting Ukraine’s energy grid; the drones appeared to be Iranian-made

title: Ukraine Strikes Russian-Controlled Melitopol
details: Ukrainian forces struck the Russia-occupied city of Melitopol in southern Ukraine; Russian state media said the strike used a U.S.-provided weapons system that can fire long-range guided rockets

title: Belarus announces troops movement
details: Belarus announced it was moving troops and military hardware in response to a threat of terrorism; the move suggests Russia is pressuring its ally into opening a new front in the war in Ukraine

title: Drone Strike Reportedly Hits Oil Depot in Russia
details: Russian officials said the strike today occurred in a region that borders Ukraine, though they did not immediately blame Ukraine; a Ukrainian official told the New York Times that Ukrainian special forces assisted with at least one of two air strikes that struck military installations hundreds of miles inside Russia yesterday

title: New wave of missile attacks in north and east Ukraine
details: Ukrainian officials reported that a new round of Russian missile attacks hit homes in Ukraine’s south and knocked out power in its north

title: Explosions occured at two Russian air bases
details: Explosions occurred at two Russian air bases far from the war’s front line; no one claimed responsibility

title: Economic sanctions were adopted by 7 countries to put a cap price on russian oil
details: To limit Russia’s ability to finance its war in Ukraine, Group of Seven (G7) countries, the European Union (EU), and Australia began implementing a price cap on seaborne Russian oil today; their tankers, credit institutions, and insurance companies will only support the shipping of Russian oil sold for $60 per barrel or less

title: EU Proposes Special Court to Probe Russian War Crimes
details: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said the bloc proposed setting up a UN-backed court to investigate Russian war crimes in Ukraine

title: U.S. Announces $53 Million Plan to Support Ukraine’s Energy Grid
details: The new funding will go toward rebuilding the grid, at least a quarter of which has been damaged by Russian strikes

title: A barrage of Russian strikes knocked out power and water supplies in Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine
Ukrainian security service and police raided an Orthodox Christian monastery
details: Ukrainian security service and police raided an Orthodox Christian monastery in Kyiv, on Nov. 22, saying it was part of an operation to "counter the destructive activities of Russian special services in Ukraine.

title: Dozen of explosions in two days around Zaphorizhzia nuclear plant
details: At least a dozen explosions have been heard near Ukraine’s Russia-occupied Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in 2 days

title: Ukraine Grain Deal Extended by 120 Days
details: The deal allowing grain to leave Ukrainian ports was set to expire on Saturday; Russia’s foreign ministry said Moscow agreed to the extension

title: Explosion at the border of Poland killed 2 people
details: North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) envoys held emergency consultations after two people were killed yesterday by a blast in a Polish city near the Ukrainian border (FT). Polish President Andrzej Duda and NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said a Ukrainian air defense missile most likely caused the explosion after Ukraine’s air defenses were triggered by a fresh round of Russian attacks on the country’s civilian infrastructure

title: Russia Conducts Extensive Missile Strikes Across Ukraine
details: Around one hundred missiles were fired at least a dozen cities or districts across the country, including Kyiv, according to the spokesman for the Ukrainian air force command Yurii Ihnat; the attacks came hours after Ukrainian President Volodymr Zelensky laid out a peace plan at the G20 summit

title: UN General Assembly Adopts Resolution Calling for Russian Reparations in Ukraine
details: Nearly 50 nations co-sponsored the resolution on establishing an international mechanism for compensation for damage, loss and injury, as well as a register to document evidence and claims. Ninety-four countries voted in favour of the resolution, and 14 against, while 73 abstained.

title: In Major Retreat, Russia Orders Withdrawal From Occupied Kherson
details: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu ordered troops to withdraw from Kherson, a southern Ukrainian city Russia captured eight months ago; Russian President Vladimir Putin has distanced himself from what could be a significant reversal to his war effort and did not appear at the televised meeting where the withdrawal was announced

title: Russian strikes have left 4.5 million Ukrainians without electricity
details: Russian strikes have left 4.5 million Ukrainians without electricity, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said

title: Russia Returns to Ukraine Grain Deal Days After Pulling Out
details: Moscow resumed participation in a deal allowing grain shipments to leave Ukrainian ports after it received guarantees that Kyiv would not use the grain corridor for military operations against Russia; it had left the deal on Saturday, citing an alleged attack on its Black Sea fleet

title: Russia orders evacuation of civilians in part of Kherson region
details: Russia ordered civilians in a nine-mile area on the eastern bank of the Dnipro River, referred to in Russia as the Dnieper River, to evacuate; it claims to have annexed the area and had already ordered people on the western bank to evacuate

title: Russia Pulls Out of Deal Allowing Grain Shipments to Leave Ukrainian Ports
details: World leaders urged Russia to rejoin the deal after Moscow withdrew over the weekend due to alleged Ukrainian drone strikes on its Black Sea fleet

title: Putin Says There Is No Need To Use Nuclear Weapons Against Ukraine
details: At a conference for international foreign policy experts, Russian President Vladimir Putin said there is “no need” to strike Ukraine with nuclear weapons; he also repeated unproven claims that Ukraine plans to frame Russia for a radioactive “dirty bomb” attack

title: Russia practiced conducting a nuclear strike
details: Russia practiced conducting a nuclear strike on Oct. 26, in its first big nuclear drill since invading Ukraine this year. The Kremlin's defense minister said it was a rehearsal for responding to a nuclear attack. It came as NATO carried out its annual Steadfast Noon nuclear exercises.

title: Ukrainian Forces Advance in Kherson
details: Ukrainian forces advanced against the Russian military in the southern Kherson region and recaptured territory from Russian mercenaries in the city of Bakhmut

title: Russian strikes lead to damage to power grid leading to 1.4 million of households without electricity
details: Russian strikes caused the worst damage to Ukraine's power grid since the war began, cutting off electricity to more than 1.4 million households in the country.

title: Evacuation of Russia-Annexed Kherson Begins Amid Ukrainian Advance
details: A Russia-installed local leader said up to sixty thousand civilians would evacuate four towns in the region ahead of a new Ukrainian offensive

title: Martial law instored by Russia in annexed territories of Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia
details: Moscow declared martial law yesterday in four Ukrainian territories it recently annexed, giving Russia-installed authorities new powers to restrict freedom of movement and impose curfews. It also announced movement restrictions in eight Russian regions bordering Ukraine; Moscow last declared martial law during World War II

title: Prisoner swap leads to the release of 108 Ukrainians and 110 Russians
details: A prisoner swap between the countries led to the release of 108 Ukrainians and 110 Russians, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said

title: Three Killed in Kyiv as Russia Unleashes Drone Strikes Across Ukraine
details: A fresh round of Russian drone strikes today targeted Ukraine’s capital, Kyiv, the cities of Odesa and Mykolaiv, and the regions of Dnipropetrovsk and Sumy, Ukrainian officials said; in Kyiv, a strike on a residential building killed at least three people

title: First convoys with Russian serviceman from joint group of troops arrive in Belarus
details: Russian troops began arriving in Belarus Oct. 15, which Minsk said were the first convoys of almost 9,000 service members expected as part of a "regional grouping" of forces allegedly to protect Belarus from threats at the border from Ukraine and the West.

title: Three-Quarters of Countries of the UN Condemn Russia’s Annexations in Ukraine
details: At the UN General Assembly yesterday, 143 countries voted to condemn Russia’s “attempted illegal annexation” of Ukrainian territories and demanded that Moscow “immediately, completely, and unconditionally withdraw all of its military forces” from Ukraine’s internationally recognized boundaries; thirty-five countries abstained from voting, including China, India, Pakistan, and South Africa, and five countries voted against the resolution

title: Russia arrests 8 people for the blast on a Crimea bridge as Ukraine denies involvement
details: Russia says it has detained eight people it suspects in carrying out last Saturday's explosion on a key bridge linking annexed Crimea to Russia.

title: Over 100 Russian missiles struck Ukraine in 3 days
details: More than one hundred Russian missiles have struck Ukraine since Monday, killing at least twenty-six people

title: Russian Missiles Strike and hit at least 10 cities accross Ukraine Following Bridge Attack
details: Russia launched its most extensive air strikes on Ukraine in months after a Russian bridge was bombed over the weekend; at least ten people were killed across Ukraine, including at least five people in the capital, Kyiv.  The Russian strikes hit at least ten Ukrainian cities, targeting infrastructure and civilian areas/

title: Moscow: Residents of Occupied Ukraine Have One Month to Accept Russian Citizenship
details: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said residents of four Ukrainian regions annexed by Russia, including people who have fled, have one month to accept or reject Russian citizenship. A similar process occurred after Russia annexed Crimea in 2014

title: Ukrainian Forces Recapture Eastern City of Lyman
details: Ukraine recpatured Lyman, which is in Donetsk, one of the four eastern Ukrainian regions annexed by Russia on Friday

title: Russian Strike In Zaporizhzhia Kills Twenty-Five Civilians
details: A Russian strike near the Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia killed at least twenty-five civilians, Ukrainian officials said

title: Moscow releases final results of referendums in occupied territories
details: Russian news agencies on Wednesday released what they called the final tallies of ballots cast in four Russian-occupied Ukrainian provinces on a referendum to join Russia. Tass, the Russian state news agency, said the ballot count showed 87 percent of voters supported joining Russia in Kherson region; 93 percent in Zaporizhzhia region; 99 percent in Donetsk region; and 98 percent in Luhansk region in the east.

title: New mobilization of troops in Ukraine decided by the Russian president
details: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a new mobilization of troops to fight in Ukraine in a televised address today; three hundred thousand reservists will be called up to fight, Russia’s defense minister said (FT). Putin also hinted at his willingness to use nuclear weapons, saying Russia “will use all the means at its disposal” if its territorial integrity is threatened

title: Ten prisoners and 200 Ukrainian fighters transfered from Russia as part of an exchange with Ukraine
details: Russia transferred ten prisoners, including Amercian citizens, to Saudia Arabia as a part of an exchange with Ukraine. Over 200 Ukrainian fighters, including commanders of the Azov Battalion that fought in Mariupol, were released in an exchange with Russia, the war’s largest.

title: Putin makes veiled reference to nuclear weapons in televised speech
details: Speech from the Russian president: “I would like to remind those who make such statements about Russia that our country also possesses various means of destruction, and in some cases, they are more modern than those of NATO countries. When the territorial integrity of our country is threatened, we, of course, will use all the means at our disposal to protect Russia and our people.

title: Russian-Controlled Kherson Announces Referendum
details: Following similar announcements by the Russian-controlled regions of Donetsk and Luhansk, separatists from Kherson, in which Russian forces control 95 percent of the territory, will also hold a referendum on joining Russia later this week

title: Two Russian-Controlled Regions Announce Referendums on Joining Russia
details: Two Russian-controlled regions in eastern Ukraine, the self-proclaimed Luhansk People's Republic (LPR) and the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR), announced plans for a referendum on joining Russia; this could signify a significant escalation in Moscow's tactics, as former president and deputy chairman of the Security Council Dmitry Medvedev claimed the de-facto annexation would enable Russia to use all necessary means to defend what it considers its legal territory

title: Ukraine Recaptures Bilohorivka
details: Ukrainian troops recaptured the town of Bilohorivka from Russian forces, meaning Russia no longer holds total control of the Luhansk region, a local official said

title: Mass grave found in Izium
details: Ukrainian authorities found a mass burial site near in a forest outside Izium, one of the northeastern cities that Ukraine took back from Russian forces earlier this month.

title: Russian missiles hit a dam in Kryvyi Rih, causing flooding
details: Russian cruise missiles hit the Ukrainian city of Kryvyi Rih, damaging a dam and causing flooding. Kryvyi Rih is President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's hometown.

title: Ukraine retakes territory in Kharkiv region
details: Ukraine has reclaimed significant territory in the northeast region of Kharkiv, forcing Russian troops to retreat from several strategic cities, including Izyum. Ukraine has now recaptured more than 6,000 square kilometres in a lightning war advance that forced Russian troops to make a hasty retreat, said Ukrainian President Volodymyyr Zelenskyy.

title: 1,000 children confirmed killed or injured in Ukraine
details: Grim milestone reached in Ukraine: 1,000 children confirmed killed or injured

title: Publication of the report from the IAEA after the visit of the Zaporishshya Plant
details: The International Atomic Energy Agency listed damage to the Russian-held Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine, in its report following an inspection. It warned military attacks at or from the plant could have catastrophic consequences, even as shelling in the area continued.

title: Ukrainian forces claim to have liberated two villages in Kherson Oblast, and one village in Donetsk Oblast
details: Ukraine claims to have liberated villages in south and east

title: Start of schools in the country
details: Ukraine's new school year began in the middle of a war. While some schools started in person, most will try to hold classes online. More than 2,000 centers of learning, from preschools to universities, have been damaged or destroyed, the Education Ministry says.

title: Ukraine announces a military counteroffensive in the South to retake territories
details: On 29 August, Zelenskyy announced the start of a full-scale counteroffensive to retake Russian-occupied territory in the south concentrating on the Kherson-Mykolaiv region, a claim that was corroborated by the Ukrainian parliament as well as Operational Command South

title: An IAEA team went to investigate the Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant
details: On 29 August 2022, an IAEA team led by Rafael Grossi went to investigate the plant

title: Ukraine marked Independence Day and the six-month anniversary of the Russian invasion
details: Ukraine marked Independence Day, which coincided with the six-month anniversary of Russia's invasion. On the same day, a Russian rocket attack killed 22 people at a train station in the town of Chaplyne.

title: The war in Ukraine has caused damage and destruction worth a total $113.5 billion
details: The war in Ukraine has caused damage and destruction worth a total $113.5 billion, according to an assessment by the Kyiv School of Economics along with Ukrainian government agencies and a number of other partners. Housing and transportation infrastructure made up the heaviest losses.

title: OHCHR reports the civilian death toll has reached 5,587, as of 21 August, though actual figure likely much higher
details: From 24 February 2022, when the Russian Federation’s armed attack against Ukraine started, to 21 August 2022, the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) recorded 13,477 civilian casualties in the country: 5,587 killed and 7,890 injured.

title: Darya Dugina: Daughter of Putin ally killed in Moscow blast
details: The daughter of a close ally of Russia's President Vladimir Putin was killed in a suspected car bombing.

title: IAEA Director General calls for mission to Zaporizhzya Nuclear Power Plant
details: The Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), renewed his urgent appeal for maximum military restraint in the area of Ukraine’s Zaporizhzya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) and the need to send an IAEA mission to carry out essential safety, security and safeguards activities at the site in southern Ukraine

title: Ukraine continues to launch attacks behind Russian lines in the Dombas and Crimea
details: Explosions were reported overnight near military bases deep within Russian-held areas of Ukraine and inside Russia’s territory itself, as Ukrainian forces appear to be demonstrating their ability to wreak havoc on Moscow’s logistics far from front lines.

title: Launch of russian rockets on Kharkiv, killing 17
details: Russia launched a barrage of rockets into the city of Kharkiv, in northeastern Ukraine, killing at least 17 civilians and destroying homes and a dormitory for deaf people.

title: Shelling of the Zaporishshia Nuclear Power Plant
details: Vladimir Rogov, the Russia-installed official in the Ukrainian city of Enerhodar, said that in the space of two hours, some 25 heavy artillery strikes from M777 howitzers had landed near the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant and residential areas. The Russian-appointed administration blamed Ukrainian forces.

title: Half million tons of grain exported from Ukraine
details: More than half a million tonnes of grain have been exported from Ukraine across the Black Sea since the beginning of August, the United Nations has said. 36 passages have been approved

title: Blast on Russian arms depot in Crimea
details: Russia’s defence ministry has said that a military warehouse near the town of Dzhankoi in northern Crimea had been damaged by sabotage

title: Shelling in Kramatorsk kills two
details: Two civilians have been killed and 13 others wounded in a Russia air raid in the eastern city of Kramatorsk, the Donetsk region’s governor has said.

title: Russian troops captured the Knauf plant near Soledar
details: Russia’s Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov has urged Ukraine’s soldiers to surrender, after Russian forces have taken control of the Knauf factory in Soledar

title: Blasts rock Russian military airbase in annexed Crimea
details: One person killed and several injured in Russian-annexed territory, with Ukraine suggesting partisans may have been responsible.

title: Four more grain ships have left Ukrainian ports bound for Turkey
details: The latest ships to set sail are bound for Turkey where they'll be inspected as part of a deal reached with Russia and the United Nations.

title: Shelling of the Zaporishshia Nuclear Power Plant
details: Ukraine and Russia have accused each other of shelling the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear power plant, with shells having hit the power lines forcing the operators to disconnect a reactor

title: Publication of a report from Amnesty International accusing Ukraine to breach international laws of war
details: Amnesty International has accused Ukraine of breaching the international laws of war by placing weapons and encampments in civilian areas with “military bases or densely wooded areas nearby”

title: First grain export from Odessa towards Turkey
details: The first vessel with grain has left Odesa under the U.N. and Turkey-brokered deal between Ukraine and Russia for the export of food from Ukraine. According to Turkey, the ship will be headed for Lebanon

title: Explosion at Olenivka prison in Donetsk, killing and injuries Ukrainian prisoners
details: An explosion occurred at Olenivka prison, killing, according to RIA, 40 captured Ukrainian POWs and wounding 75. Ukraine's General Staff stated that the strike was committed by Russia to hide the torture and executions of Ukrainian prisoners of war.

title: Russian forces launch missile attacks on northern Ukraine
details: At least six missiles hit the outskirts of the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, wounding 15 people, officials say.

title: Massive Russian redeployment of Russian forces reported in the Kherson region
details: Ukraine stepped up its drive to retake its Russian-controlled south by trying to bomb and isolate Russian troops in hard-to-resupply areas, but it said on Thursday it saw evidence that Moscow was redeploying its forces to defend the territory.

title: Antonivka bridge leading to Kherson city closed to civilians
details: The Antonivka bridge has been closed to civilians. According to the BBC, Western officials described the bridge as "completely unusable" and UK officials said that Kherson city is now "virtually cut off from other occupied territories".

title: Capture of the Vuhlehirska Power station by the Russian troops
details: Russian forces reportedly captured the Vuhlehirska Power Station, the second biggest power plant in Ukraine, on the approach to Bakhmut.

title: Bombing of Odessa by Russian troops
details: Russian forces bombed the Ukrainian port city of Odessa over the weekend, drawing questions surrounding Russia’s intentions to honor a deal made with Ukraine on Friday to restart grain exports

title: Deal signed by both parties to free grain exports
details: Russia and Ukraine signed a U.N. and Turkey-brokered deal to free grain exports blockaded by Russia in Ukraine's Black Sea ports.

title: OHCHR has recorded the killing of over 5,000 civilians since the start of the war, although the actual figure is expected to be much higher
details: From 24 February 2022, when the Russian Federation’s armed attack against Ukraine started, to 17 July 2022, the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) recorded 11,862 civilian casualties in the country: 5,110 killed and 6,752 injured.

title: Russia officially extends its war goals beyond the eastern Donbas region
details: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday that Moscow's military "tasks" in Ukraine now went beyond the eastern Donbas region, in the clearest acknowledgment yet that it has expanded its war goals.

title: Large evacuation with close to 29,000 of civilians from Donbas to Russia
details: 28,424 people, including 5,148 children" have been evacuated from the Donbas and other parts of Ukraine to Russia. In total since Feb 24, some "2,612,747 people, of which 412,553 are children" have been evacuated to Russia.

title: Russian attacks in Vinnytsia leads to 23 casualties
details: Russian missiles have struck a city far from the eastern frontline, killing at least 23 people including three children, Ukrainian officials say. More than 100 were reported injured in the attack in Vinnytsia, which is south-west of Kyiv and a long way from the heart of the fighting in Donbas.

title: 7,200 Ukrainian personnel have gone missing since the start of the war
details: Oleh Kotenko, the Ukrainian Ombudsman, claims that 7,200 Ukrainian personnel (including "National Guard, border guards and the security service" ) have gone missing since the start of the war

title: One-third of the country’s population has been displaced by the conflict
details: The Russian invasion of Ukraine that began on 24 February 2022 has displaced one-third of the country’s population. Over 6.2 million people remain internally displaced within Ukraine, and there were over 5.6 million Ukrainian refugees recorded across Europe in early July

title: Russia takes full control of Luhansk as Ukrainian forces withdraw from Lysychansk
details: Russia says it controls Ukraine's Luhansk region, one of the two eastern regions that have been the focus of its invasion. The announcement comes after Ukrainian troops withdrew from Lysychansk.

title: Missiles launched by Russian troops on a shopping centre in Kremenchuk kills 20 people
details: Russia launched missiles at a shopping centre in Kremenchuk with more than 1,000 people inside, killing at least 20 people. Russia reportedly denied hitting the shopping mall

title: Ukrainian forces withdraw from Sievierodonetsk
details: After weeks of bloody street fighting and months of withering artillery fire, Ukrainian forces will withdraw from Sievierodonetsk, a city that President Volodymyr Zelensky once said would determine the “fate” of the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine. It represents the most significant loss for the Ukrainian military since Russian forces seized Mariupol a month before.

title: Vast majority of Russian munitions in Ukraine are ‘unguided’
details: According to the New York Times newspaper, more than 210 weapons used by Russian troops that were identified were types that have been widely banned under a variety of international treaties.

title: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg warns that the war in Ukraine could drag on for years
details: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg warns that the war in Ukraine could drag on for years and calls for the supply of more state-of-the-art weaponry to Ukrainian troops.

title: Every bridge leading to key Seeverodonetsk destroyed
details: In a social media post on Monday, Luhansk Governor Serhiy Haidai said all three bridges into Severodonetsk were destroyed and the residents remaining in the city were being forced to survive in "extremely difficult conditions

title: Large depot with western weapons destroyed in Ternopil region
details: The Russian Defence Ministry stated that it used Kalibr cruise missiles to destroy a large depot with Western weapons in Ukraine's Ternopil region.

title: Russian forces control most of the city of Sievierodonetsk in Eastern Ukraine
details: Russian forces control most of the city of Sievierodonetsk in eastern Ukraine, with Ukrainians holding ground in its industrial zone, the governor of Luhansk said on social media. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy described the battle as the epicenter and key to the fate of the Donbas region.

title: The war in Uraine reaches its 100th Day
details: After 100 days of war, about 20% of Ukraine's territory is now under Russian control, President Volodymyr Zelensky said, adding the Donbas region is "almost entirely destroyed.

title: Approximately 20% of Ukraine is now under the control of Russian Forces
details: After 100 days of war, about 20% of Ukraine's territory is now under Russian control, President Volodymyr Zelensky said, adding the Donbas region is "almost entirely destroyed.

title: Ukraine stated that it was losing 100 soldiers per day
details: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky claimed Tuesday that his country is losing as many as 100 soldiers a day as Russia presses its military offensive in the eastern Donbas region, where street-by-street fighting is being reported in some areas.

title: OHCHR reports civilian casualties have topped 9,000 with over 4,000 killed thought the figure is likely to be much higher
details: From 4 a.m. on 24 February 2022, when the Russian Federation’s armed attack against Ukraine started, to 24:00 midnight on 31 May 2022 (local time), OHCHR recorded 9,094 civilian casualties in the country: 4,149 killed and 4,945 injured

title: The number of displaced persons in Ukraine drops for the first time to around 7.1 million
details: Results of the general population survey show that, as of 23 May 2022, 16.2% of the general population were internally displaced within Ukraine, equivalent to over 7M individuals. This represents a decrease of nearly 900,000 IDPs (11%) since 3 May, a first estimated reduction in the number of IDPs in Ukraine since 24 February 2022

title: Approximately 4.5 million previously displaced people have returned to their areas of origin
details: Approximately 4.5 million previously displaced people have returned to their areas of origin

title: Ukraine extended martial law for three months, until August 23
details: Ukraine extended martial law for three months, until August 23, as the war with Russia drags on.

title: Russian forces intensified efforts to encircle and capture Severodonetsk
details: Russian forces intensified efforts to encircle and capture Severodonetsk (Luhansk Oblast) on May 21

title: Russian troops pushed back from the Kharkiv region
details: Ukrainian military officials reported that some Russian troops withdrawn from the Kharkiv City axis have redeployed to western Donetsk Oblast on May 19. Ukraine said its forces had pushed back Russian troops in the Kharkiv region in a counter-offensive that allowed the Ukrainians to reach the Russian border.

title: OHCHR reports the civilian death toll has reached 3,838, as of 19 May, though actual figure likely much higher
details: From 4 a.m. on 24 February 2022, when the Russian Federation’s armed attack against Ukraine started, to 24:00 midnight on 19 May 2022 (local time), the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) recorded 8,189 civilian casualties in the country: 3,838 killed and 4,351 injured

title: Russia’s defense ministry said 1,730 Ukrainian fighters had surrendered in Mariupol over three days
details: Russia’s defense ministry said 1,730 Ukrainian fighters had surrendered in Mariupol over three days, including 771 in the past 24 hours, claiming a surrender on a far bigger scale than Ukraine has acknowledged.

title: The U.S. Senate voted to approve a $40 billion aid package for Ukraine
details: The U.S. Senate overwhelmingly approved nearly $40 billion in new aid for Ukraine. The Senate voted 86-11 in favor of the emergency package of military, economic and humanitarian assistance, by far the largest U.S. aid package for Ukraine to date.

title: Fighters evacuated from Mariupol steelworks signifying the end of the 82-day assault
details: More than 260 Ukrainian soldiers, many of them wounded, have been evacuated from the besieged Azovstal steel plant in the port city of Mariupol, appearing to cede control of the city to Russia after 82 days of bombardment.

title: Ukraine and Japan have signed an agreement on a $100 million loan intended primarily to help support vulnerable people in Ukraine.
details: Ukraine and Japan have signed an agreement on a $100 million loan intended primarily to help support vulnerable people in Ukraine.

title: More than 260 Ukrainian fighters were evacuated from the Azovstal steel plant (Mariupol)
details: More than 260 Ukrainian fighters were evacuated from the Azovstal steel plant in the besieged port city of Mariupol, Ukrainian officials said.

title: First Russian Soldier goes on trial for war crimes
details: A Russian soldier will be accused of murdering a 62-year-old civilian when he appears in the dock on Friday, with the case coming as the number of crimes registered by Ukraine’s general prosecutor surpassed 11,000

title: OHCHR reports the civilian death toll has reached 3,280
details: From 4 a.m. on 24 February 2022, when the Russian Federation’s armed attack against Ukraine started, to 24:00 midnight on 4 May 2022 (local time), the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) recorded 6,731 civilian casualties in the country: 3,280 killed and 3,451 injured.

title: Over 2.5 million Ukrainians registered for EU protection
details: Some 2,514,738 Ukrainian refugees have registered for temporary protection status in the EU, as of Monday (2 May). The UN refugee agency (UNHCR) says over 5.6 million people have fled Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion, with most having gone to Poland

title: UN and partners evacuate 101 civilians from Azovstal steel plant, Mariupol
details: SHumanitarian Coordinator for Ukraine, Osnat Lubrani confirms that 101 civilians have successfully been evacuated from the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol and other areas in a safe passage operation coordinated by the United Nations (UN) and the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)

title: over 8 million internally displaced people in Ukraine
details: The latest IOM general population survey estimates that there are 8,029,000 internally displaced people in Ukraine

title: 1.3 million returns to Ukraine have been registered
details: This figure reflects cross-border movements, which can be pendular, and does not necessarily indicate sustainable returns as the situation across Ukraine remains highly volatile and unpredictable.

title: Ukraine announced the temporary closure of its four main seaports after losing control of them to Russian forces.
details: Ukraine has announced the temporary closure of its four main seaports (Berdyansk, Mariupol, Skadovsk, and Kherson) after losing control of them to Russian forces. The announcement is mainly a formality since Russia has blockaded or captured the seaports since launching its unprovoked invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

title: over 5.5 million people have left Ukraine to neighbouring countries
details: Over 5.5 million people have left Ukraine to neighbouring countries

title: 21,700 asylum applications in EU+ countries have been filed by Ukrainian refugees
details: 21,700 asylum applications in EU+ countries have been filed by Ukrainian refugees since the war began, the EUAA has revealed. The majority of the rest of the Ukrainian refugees who have reached the EU+ countries have registered for temporary protection.

title: Russian officials reported blasts in three Russian provinces that border Ukraine
details: Russian officials reported blasts in three Russian provinces that border Ukraine

title: OHCHR reports the civilian death toll has reached 2,729 though actual figure likely much higher
details: From 4 a.m. on 24 February 2022, when the Russian Federation’s armed attack against Ukraine started, to 24:00midnight on 25 April 2022 (local time), the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) recorded 5,840 civilian casualties in the country: 2,729 killed and 3,111 injured

title: Five railway stations were hit by missiles in central and western Ukraine
details: On 25 April, the Head of Ukrainian railways announced that five railway stations were hit by missiles in central and western Ukraine during the morning. According to media reports citing Ukrainian officials, at least five people were killed during the attacks in Zhmerynka and Kozyatyn towns in Vinnytsia oblast.

title: Explosions in Transdniestria region of Moldova exacerbate fears of spreading conflict
details: On Monday, government buildings in Tiraspol were hit by what appeared to be rocket-propelled grenades. In the following days, blasts hit a radio tower broadcasting in Russian, and shots were reportedly fired near a Russian arms depot.

title: Thermal power plant struck by missiles in Poltavska
details: On 24 April, missiles reportedly struck a thermal power plant and oil refinery in Kremenchuk in Poltavska blast (centre), killing one person and injuring seven.

title: Physical damage to Ukraine's infrastructure has reached $60 billion
details:
On 21 April, the World Bank announced that physical damage
to Ukraine’s buildings and infrastructure has reached roughly
US$ 60 billion.

title: Russia controls 80% of Luhansk in Eastern Donbas
details: A Ukrainian official said Russia now controls 80 percent of Luhansk, one of two regions in Ukraine’s eastern Donbas

title: RF declare Mariupol is now under their control
details: Putin cancels Russian plans to storm Mariupol steel plant, opts for blockade instead

title: Martial law extended in Ukraine by the Parliament until May 25th
details:
Martial law in Ukraine has been extended until 25 May 2022,
as intense fighting and airstrikes continue to cause civilian
casualties and damage to civilian infrastructure.

title: OHCHR reports the civilian death toll has reached 2,072 though actual figure likely much higher
Those displaced into neigbouring countries reaches 5 million
details: Those displaced into neigbouring countries reaches 5 million

title: Capture of Kreminaa city by Russian troops
details: Ukraine said the new assault had resulted in the capture of Kreminna, an administrative centre of 18,000 people in Luhansk, one of the two Donbas provinces.

title: New Russian offensive commences against eastern oblasts
details: Russian forces began a new phase of large-scale offensive operations in eastern Ukraine on April 18 likely intended to capture the entirety of Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts

title: Russian ultimatum for the remaining Ukrainian troops there to surrender in Mariupol expires
details: Russian ultimatum for the remaining Ukrainian troops there to surrender in Mariupol expired early on April 17 with Ukranian resistance continuing

title: Russian warship: Moskva sinks in Black Sea
details: Moskva, the flagship of Russia's Black Sea Fleet, was being towed to port when "stormy seas" caused it to sink after it had sustained damage in an earlier incident claimed to be a missle strike by Ukraine, but an accident on board by Russia

title: President Vladimir Putin said on Tuesday peace talks with Ukraine had hit a dead end
details: President Vladimir Putin said on Tuesday peace talks with Ukraine had hit a dead end

title: Over 10 million Ukrainian civilians displaced and 1,800 dead
details: The United Nations found that the war in Ukraine has now displaced ten million civilians and killed more than 1,800

title: An attack on Kramatorsk railway station causes 130 civlian casualties amongst evacuee families
details: On the morning of 8 April, a railway station in Kramatorsk came under attack, reportedly resulting in at least 130 civilian casualties,. The attack took place as hundreds of people waited to board evacuation trains en route to western Ukraine

title: Mounting evidence of war cimes in Bucha and other areas around Kyiv
details: Evidence is mounting of the killing of civlians in Bucha where Ukrainian forces have retaken control

title: Over 7 million internally displaced persons in Ukraine
details: Results of the general population survey show that as of 1 April 2022, 16% of the general population are currently internally displaced within Ukraine, equivalent to 7.1M individuals. This represents an increase of nearly 661,000 IDPs (10%) since March 16.

title: Russia pulled out of the closed Chernobyl nuclear power plant
details: Russian forces hey pulled out of the closed Chernobyl nuclear power plant; a UN watchdog is investigating whether they departed due to radiation poisoning

title: OPEC decides to continue low oil production
24 hours ceasefire in Mariupol followed by failed attempt of civilians' evacuation
details: A Red Cross convoy traveling to the besieged Ukrainian port of Mariupol turned around because it had become impossible to proceed with its mission to evacuate civilians, the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) said.

title: 10% of Ukraine's population has fled the country
details: More than 4 million people, or almost 10% of Ukraine’s pre-war population, have fled their home country since the start of the Russian invasion in late February, the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi said Wednesday.

title: Peace talks in Istanbul between the two countries
details: After more than a month of talks — first in person in Belarus, then in recent weeks by video link — the diplomacy between Ukraine and Russia running in parallel to their war entered a new phase in Istanbul. David Arakhamia, the head of the nine-person Ukrainian delegation, said that holding the talks in Turkey was a “victory” in itself, because Turkey “is our friend and partner.”

title: Areas around Kyiv retaken by Ukraine
details: Ukraine says its forces have retaken a key suburb west of the capital Kyiv from Russian control after weeks of fierce fighting, as negotiators from both sides met for the first peace talks in two weeks in the Turkish city of Istanbul.

title: Ukrainian President says his country is ready to discuss adopting neutral status
details: Ukraine proposed adopting neutral status in exchange for security guarantees at talks with Russia in Turkey, meaning it would not join military alliances or host military bases, Ukrainian negotiators said on Tuesday

title: Damage caused to Ukraine’s infrastructure during the war has reached USD 63 billion
details: As of March 24, the damage caused to Ukraine’s infrastructure during the war has already reached $63 billion, or more than UAH 1,8 trillion.

title: Agreement between Russia and Ukraine on 9 humanitarian corridors , excluding Mariupol
details: Agreement has been reached to try to evacuate civilians trapped in Ukrainian towns and cities through nine "humanitarian corridors" on Wednesday 23, Deputy Prime Minister Iryna Vereshchuk said.

title: Over 2,500 civilian casualties reported
details: From 4 a.m. on 24 February 2022, when the Russian Federation’s armed attack against Ukraine started, to 24:00 midnight on 23 March 2022 (local time), the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) recorded 2,685 civilian casualties in the country: 1,035 killed and 1,650 injured.

title: Ukraine rejects Russia's demand to surrender Mariupol
details: Ukraine defied Russia’s demand that it surrender the besieged port city of Mariupol, where residents face acute shortages of food, water, and heat amid Russian bombardments

title: More than ten million people have been displaced internally or externally by the war
details: At least 10 million people have fled their homes in Ukraine due to the "devastating" war in the country, the UN refugee chief said on Sunday.

title: Close to 2,500 civilian casualties reported
details: As of 21 March, the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) reports 2,421 civilian casualties, including 925 killed, figures that are likely much higher and will continue to rise.

title: Raid hits airport near Lviv full of civilians
details: In Ukraine today, Russian missiles struck an airport near Lviv, where hundreds of thousands of people have gone to escape fighting in other cities

title: ICJ orders Russia to halt military operations in Ukraine
details: The United Nations' top court for disputes between states, the International Court of Justice (ICJ), ordered Russia on Wednesday to immediately halt its military operations in Ukraine, saying it was "profoundly concerned" by Moscow's use of force.

title: 3 million people fled Ukraine
details: Some 3,000,381 people have so far left Ukraine, data from the U.N. Refugee Agency (UNHCR) showed. It is basing its aid plans on 4 million refugees but has said the figure will likely increase.

title: Raid hits Mariupol theatre full of civilians killing 300
details: Ukrainian officials accuse Russian forces of bombing a theatre hosting over 500 citizens in the besieged city of Mariupol. Moscow denies carrying out the air raid.

title: 6.48M individuals are internally displaced within Ukraine
details: Results of IOM’s assessment show that as of 16 March 2022, 14.7% of the general population are currently internally displaced within Ukraine, equivalent to 6.48M individuals

title: 35 hour Curfew imposed in Kyiv after civilian buildings hit by airstrikes and missiles
details: A curfew was imposed on the Ukrainian capital Kyiv from 8pm on Tuesday to 7am on Thursday after several apartment blocks were struck by Russian forces based outside the city

title: Martial law extended in Ukraine by the Parliament
Fourth round of talk between Ukrainians and Russians
details: Ukraine declared it will not demand to join NATO.

title: Evacuation of thousands of residents from front-line cities (including Mariupol after several days of failed attemps)
details: A convoy of at least 160 cars left Mariupol on Monday in the first successful attempt to arrange a humanitarian corridor out of the encircled Ukrainian city after over a week of trying. More than 2,500 residents have been killed there since the Russian invasion on Feb. 24, a Ukrainian official said.

title: $40 million allocated by UN from Emergency Fund for Ukraine
details: As humanitarian needs escalate rapidly in Ukraine, the United Nations humanitarian chief, Martin Griffiths, today allocated US$40 million from the Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF) to ramp up aid agencies’ efforts to reach the most vulnerable people.

title: $925 million dollars mobilized by the World Bank to support Ukraine
details: he World Bank today announced nearly $200 million in additional and reprogrammed financing to bolster Ukraine’s social services for vulnerable people. This comes on top of the $723 million mobilized for Ukraine and its people last week, of which $350 million has already been disbursed to Ukraine. This financing is part of the $3 billion package of support that the World Bank Group previously announced it is preparing for Ukraine over the coming months.

title: Anti war protests held across Europe
details: Anti-war protests were held in Russia and in European capitals, including Berlin, London, and Warsaw

title: Expansion of russian air strikes to northwest and southwest of Ukraine
details: Russia extended the range of its air strikes to now reach parts of Ukraine’s northwest and southwest and ordered foreign fighters be deployed to the conflict zone. Russian forces have also attacked twenty-six health-care facilities across the country.

title: 2.5 million people fled Uktraine
details: Some 2.5 million people have fled Ukraine since Russia invaded two weeks ago, and another two million have been internally displaced by the war, the United Nations said.

title: $13.6 Billion approved by US to support Ukraine
details: Measure supported by Biden will provide $6.5bn to the Pentagon for military assistance, $6.7bn to care for refugees.

title: 300 million euros disbursed by the European Commission for Ukraine
details: The European Commission disbursed today €300 million in emergency Macro-Financial Assistance (MFA) to Ukraine. The disbursement of funds has been fast-tracked to help enhance Ukraine's macroeconomic stability in the context of Russia's unprovoked and unjustified invasion.

title: Russian airstrike on a maternity hospital in Mariupol
details: Three people including a child were killed in a Russian strike on a maternity and children's hospital in the city of Mariupol

title: $1.4 Billion approved by IMF to support Ukraine
details: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) today approved a disbursement of US$1.4 billion (SDR 1,005.9 million) under the Rapid Financing Instrument (RFI) to help meet urgent financing needs and mitigate the economic impact of the war.

title: More than two million people fled Ukraine
Third round of talks between Ukrainians and Russians and agreement on humanitarian corridors
details: Although agreements have been made for humanitarian corridors to allow for the evacuation of civilians, those plans so far have faltered.

title: Second day of failure of cease-fire in Mariupol
details: The National Guard of Ukraine says Sunday's cease-fire was broken and the evacuation plans have been halted after Russian forces opened fire.

title: Takeover of the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Station in Ukraine by Russian troops
details: Russian forces seized Europe’s largest nuclear power plant, the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Station in Ukraine, after clashes at the plant caused a fire and sparked fears of a nuclear disaster.

title: A total of one million people fled Ukraine in the seven days since the Russian invasion began
details: One million people fled Ukraine during the war’s first seven days in what could become Europe’s largest refugee crisis this century, the UN refugee agency said

title: Second round of talks between Ukrainians and Russians and agreement on humanitarian corridors
details: Kyiv and Moscow agree on plan for safe corridors to evacuate civilians, notably in the city of Mariupol.

title: Takeover of Kherson (Southern Ukraine) by the Russian troops
details: Russian forces take over Ukraine’s most strategic city, Kherson

title: Investigation launch by ICC on war crimes commited by Russia in Ukraine
details: A war crimes investigation has been launched into Russia’s invasion of Ukraine after an unprecedented number of countries backed the move and Boris Johnson called the military intervention “abhorrent”.

title: UN Resolution demanding the cessation of hostilities
details: The UN General Assembly overwhelmingly adopted a resolution on Wednesday demanding that Russia immediately end its military operations in Ukraine.

title: Flash Appeal for Ukraine launched by the United Nations
details: With the scale and direction of the ongoing military operation, 18 million people are projected to become affected, including up to 6.7 million people projected to be newly internally displaced. Of the affected population, 12 million people are expected to need humanitarian assistance, and 6 million with the most urgent humanitarian needs will be assisted with the resources required under this Flash Appeal, including 2.1 million IDPs covering the initial period of three months. The Flash Appeal 2022 supersedes the 2022 Humanitarian Response Plan (HRP), as of 1 March.

title: First round of Ukrainian-Russian talks
details: Russia and Ukraine hold a first round of ceasefire talks at the Belarusian border. They disband after five hours without an agreement.

title: Request from Ukraine to join the European Union
Adoption of a decree in Ukraine to give visas to foreigners wishing to join the Ukrainian army
details: On February 26, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy put out a call to foreign volunteers to join the Ukrainian armed forces, announcing the creation of an international legion. Two days later, the president signed a decree waiving visas for any foreign nationals wishing to join the Ukrainian army, while the foreign affairs ministry launched a website providing details on how to apply.

title: Extension of curfew in Kyiv
details: A 3 days-curfew was imposed in the city of Kiev to protect from expected russian attacks. A prolongation was also decided for every night (5pm-8am).

title: Russian Launches military invasion of Ukraine. Missile and artillery attacks in Ukraine by Russia (including Kyiv)
details: Russian troops have quickly expanded their presence across Ukraine, with military clashes ongoing in other major cities: Chernihiv (north), Kharkiv (north-east), Kherson (south), Mariupol (south -east), Mykolaiv (south), Odessa (south-west), Sumy (north), among other cities.

title: Adoption of the Martial law in Ukraine
details: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy declared martial law across the entire country after Russia attacked early Thursday morning.

title: Curfew imposed in Kyiv
details: The mayor of Kyiv imposed a curfew on Thursday after Russia invaded Ukraine, running from 10pm until 7am.

title: Declaration of a state of emergency in Ukraine
details: The state of emergency allows authorities to impose restrictions on movement, block rallies and ban political parties and organizations "in the interests of national security and public order" for 30 days.

title: Recognition of Luhansk and Donetsk as independent states by Russia. Russian invasion in eastern Ukraine.
details: Putin orders what he called peacekeeping forces into two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine, after recognising them as independent.
